oops sorry
if it is your only / everyday system   ... dual boot it , or make full backup or hold off for a week as support catches up
while I dont know the answer. YOu need to tell people how you installed FF3   from our repos or did you download it yourself
Whos looking?  I just installed the firefox-3.0 package in synaptic..
Please move discussions and opinions to offtopic..
Were you trying to install a version other than the one available in our repos
Did you change any sources before the apt-get
doesnt matter...
sudo apt-get install pastebinit  && cat /etc/apt/sources.list | pastebinit (Provide Pastebin link in channel)
looking now
mixing gutsy and hardy repos is not a good idea
It may nave been what got you...  I have no way of knowing.. I would remove # the gutsy repo  update, upgrade and hope for the best
You know a single command in a terminal will backup everything for you..
yes
If you after you reinstall..  you can doa system backup very easily
too late for a backup
for the next time
the command is fine..  just backup if you end up reinstalling or create a sep /home.. it will save you a lot of frustration
tar cvpzf backup.tgz --exclude=/backup.tgz --exclude=/proc --exclude=/dev --exclude=/lost+found  --exclude=/mnt --exclude=/sys --exclude=/media --exclude=/root/.Trash -- /
yes everything should be in ~   but double check your bookmarks and save them to your desktop
good luck, sorry it wasnt a simpler soultion
